00010 // Check against redundant including
00011 #ifndef TT_ADSR_H
00012 #define TT_ADSR_H
00013 
00014 // Include appropriate headers
00015 #include "tt_audio_base.h"

00018 /********************************************************
00019         CLASS INTERFACE/IMPLEMENTATION
00020 
00021         The entire class is implemented inline for speed.
00022  ********************************************************/
00023 
00024 class tt_adsr:public tt_audio_base{
00025 
00026         private:
00027                 // Function pointer for the DSP Loop (use this instead of branching for speed)
00028                 typedef void (tt_adsr::*function_ptr_0in_1out)(tt_audio_signal *);
00029                 typedef void (tt_adsr::*function_ptr_1in_1out)(tt_audio_signal *, tt_audio_signal *);
00030                 function_ptr_0in_1out dsp_executor;
00031                 function_ptr_1in_1out dsp_executor2;
00032 
00033                 // Attributes Values & Variables
00034                 tt_attribute_value                              attack_ms;
00035                 long                                                    attack_samples;
00036                 double                                                  attack_step;
00037                 double                                                  attack_step_db;
00038 
00039                 tt_attribute_value                              decay_ms;
00040                 long                                                    decay_samples;
00041                 double                                                  decay_step;
00042                 double                                                  decay_step_db;
00043                 
00044                 tt_attribute_value                              sustain_amp;
00045                 tt_attribute_value                              sustain_db;
00046 
00047                 tt_attribute_value                              release_ms;
00048                 long                                                    release_samples;
00049                 double                                                  release_step;
00050                 double                                                  release_step_db;
00051                 
00052                 tt_attribute_value_discrete     mode;                           // one of the selectors defined below
00053                 bool                                                    trigger;                        // on/off
00054                 short                                                   eg_state;                       // one of the eg_states defined below
00055                 tt_sample_value                                 output;
00056                 tt_sample_value                                 output_db;
00057 
00058                 enum constants{
00059                         NOISE_FLOOR = -120,                                                     // noise floor in decibels (value at which to cut to 0.0)
00060                 };
00061                 
00062                 enum eg_states{
00063                         k_eg_inactive,
00064                         k_eg_attack,
00065                         k_eg_decay,
00066                         k_eg_sustain,
00067                         k_eg_release
00068                 };
00069                 
00070         
00071         public:
00072                 enum selectors{                                                                 // Attribute Selectors
00073                         k_attack,
00074                         k_decay,
00075                         k_sustain,
00076                         k_sustain_db,
00077                         k_release,
00078                         k_mode,
00079                                 k_mode_linear,
00080                                 k_mode_exponential,
00081                 };
00082                 
00083 
00084                 // OBJECT LIFE                                  
00085                 tt_adsr()                                                                               // Constructor          
00086                 {
00087                         output = 0.0;
00088                         output_db = NOISE_FLOOR;
00089                         eg_state = k_eg_inactive;
00090 
00091                         // set defaults
00092                         set_attr(k_mode, k_mode_linear);
00093                         set_attr(k_attack, 50.0);
00094                         set_attr(k_decay, 100.0);
00095                         set_attr(k_sustain_db, -6.0);
00096                         set_attr(k_release, 500.0 );
00097                 }
00098 
00099                 ~tt_adsr()                                                                              // Destructor
00100                 {
00101                         ;
00102                 }
00103 
00104 
00105                 void set_attr(tt_selector sel, tt_attribute_value val)  // Set Attributes
00106                 {
00107                         switch (sel){
00108                                 case k_attack:
00109                                         attack_ms = clip(val, 1.f, 60000.f);
00110                                         attack_samples = long((attack_ms / 1000.0) * sr);
00111                                         attack_step = 1.0 / attack_samples;
00112                                         attack_step_db = -(double(NOISE_FLOOR) / attack_samples);
00113                                         break;
00114                                 case k_decay:
00115                                         decay_ms = clip(val, 1.f, 60000.f);
00116                                         decay_samples = long((decay_ms / 1000.0) * sr);
00117                                         decay_step = 1.0 / decay_samples;
00118                                         decay_step_db = -(double(NOISE_FLOOR) / decay_samples);
00119                                         break;
00120                                 case k_sustain_db:
00121                                         sustain_amp = clip(decibels_to_amplitude(val), -96.f,36.f);
00122                                         sustain_db = val;
00123                                         break;
00124                                 case k_sustain:
00125                                         sustain_amp = val;
00126                                         sustain_db = amplitude_to_decibels(val);
00127                                         break;
00128                                 case k_release:
00129                                         release_ms = clip(val, 1.f, 60000.f);
00130                                         release_samples = long((release_ms / 1000.0) * sr);
00131                                         release_step = 1.0 / release_samples;
00132                                         release_step_db = -(double(NOISE_FLOOR) / release_samples);
00133                                         break;
00134                                 case k_mode:
00135                                         mode = (tt_attribute_value_discrete)val;
00136                                         if(mode == k_mode_linear){
00137                                                 dsp_executor = &tt_adsr::dsp_vector_calc_linear;
00138                                                 dsp_executor2 = &tt_adsr::dsp_vector_calc_linear;       
00139                                         }
00140                                         else if(mode == k_mode_exponential){
00141                                                 dsp_executor = &tt_adsr::dsp_vector_calc_exponential;
00142                                                 dsp_executor2 = &tt_adsr::dsp_vector_calc_exponential;
00143                                         }
00144                                         break;
00145                                 default:
00146                                         log_error("tt_adsr::set_attr - invalid attribute");
00147                                         break;
00148                         }
00149                 }
00150 
00151                 tt_attribute_value get_attr(tt_selector sel)                            // Get Attributes
00152                 {
00153                         switch (sel){
00154                                 case k_attack:
00155                                         return attack_ms;
00156                                 case k_decay:
00157                                         return decay_ms;
00158                                 case k_sustain_db:
00159                                         return amplitude_to_decibels(sustain_amp);
00160                                 case k_sustain:
00161                                         return sustain_amp;
00162                                 case k_release:
00163                                         return release_ms;
00164                                 case k_mode:
00165                                         return mode;
00166                                 default:
00167                                         log_error("tt_adsr::set_attr - invalid attribute");
00168                                         return 0;
00169                                         break;
00170                         }
00171                 }
00172                                 
00173 
00174                 // METHOD: CONTROL-RATE TRIGGER
00175                 void set_trigger(bool val)
00176                 {
00177                         trigger = val;
00178                 }
00179                 
00180                 
00181                 /*****************************************************
00182                  * DSP LOOPS
00183                  *****************************************************/
00184                 
00185                 // Publically exposed interface for CONTROL RATE triggered dsp routine
00186                 void dsp_vector_calc(tt_audio_signal *out)
00187                 {
00188                         (*this.*dsp_executor)(out);     // Run the function pointed to by our function pointer
00189                 }
00190         
00191                 // Publically exposed interface for SIGNAL RATE triggered dsp routine
00192                 void dsp_vector_calc(tt_audio_signal *in, tt_audio_signal *out)
00193                 {
00194                         (*this.*dsp_executor2)(in, out);        // Run the function pointed to by our function pointer
00195                 }
00196         
00197         private:
00198                 // DSP LOOP: CONTROL-RATE TRIGGER - LINEAR
00199                 void dsp_vector_calc_linear(tt_audio_signal *out)
00200                 {
00201                         temp_vs = out->vectorsize;
00202                     while(temp_vs--){
00203                     
00204                         // STEP 1: SET THE CORRECT STATE
00205                                 if(trigger){                    // WHEN THE TRIGGER IS ON
00206                                         if((eg_state == k_eg_inactive) || (eg_state == k_eg_release)){  // if a note isn't on,
00207                                                 eg_state = k_eg_attack;                                                                         // set to attack
00208                                         }
00209                                 }
00210                                 else{                                   // WHEN THE TRIGGER IS OFF
00211                                         if((eg_state != k_eg_inactive) && (eg_state != k_eg_release)){  // if a note is on,
00212                                                 eg_state = k_eg_release;                                                                        // release it
00213                                         }                               
00214                                 }
00215                                 
00216                                 // STEP 2: CALCULATE THE APPROPRIATE VALUES
00217                                 switch(eg_state){
00218                                         case k_eg_attack:                                               // ATTACK
00219                                                 output += attack_step;                                  // Increment the output
00220                                                 if (output >= 1.0){                                             // If we've hit the top of the attack,
00221                                                         eg_state = k_eg_decay;                          // start the decay stage
00222                                                         output = 1.0;                                           // Make sure we didn't go over 1.0
00223                                                 }               
00224                                                 break;
00225                                         case k_eg_decay:                                                // DECAY
00226                                                 output -= decay_step;                                   // Decrement the output
00227                                                 if (output <= sustain_amp){                             // If we've hit the bottom of the decay,
00228                                                         eg_state = k_eg_sustain;                        // start the sustain stage
00229                                                         output = sustain_amp;                           // Lock in the sustain value
00230                                                 }
00231                                                 break;
00232                                         case k_eg_sustain:                                              // SUSTAIN
00233                                                 break;                                                                  // leave it alone
00234                                                                         
00235                                         case k_eg_release:                                              // RELEASE
00236                                                 output -= release_step;                                 // Decrement the output
00237                                                 if (output <= 0.0){                                             // If we've hit the basement,
00238                                                         eg_state = k_eg_inactive;                       // deactivate the eg
00239                                                         output = 0.0;                                           // Make sure we didn't dip too low
00240                                                 }
00241                                                 break;
00242                                 }
00243                                 
00244                                 // STEP 3: OUTPUT                                               
00245                         *out->vector++ = output;
00246                     }
00247                     out->reset();
00248                 }
00249 
00250                 
00251                 // DSP LOOP: SIGNAL TRIGGER - LINEAR
00252                 void dsp_vector_calc_linear(tt_audio_signal *in, tt_audio_signal *out)
00253                 {
00254                         temp_vs = out->vectorsize;
00255                     while(temp_vs--){
00256                         trigger = (bool)((*in->vector++) > 0.5);        // **** SIGNAL-RATE TRIGGER
00257 
00258                         // STEP 1: SET THE CORRECT STATE
00259                                 if(trigger){                    // WHEN THE TRIGGER IS ON
00260                                         if((eg_state == k_eg_inactive) || (eg_state == k_eg_release)){  // if a note isn't on,
00261                                                 eg_state = k_eg_attack;                                                                         // set to attack
00262                                         }
00263                                 }
00264                                 else{                                   // WHEN THE TRIGGER IS OFF
00265                                         if((eg_state != k_eg_inactive) && (eg_state != k_eg_release)){  // if a note is on,
00266                                                 eg_state = k_eg_release;                                                                        // release it
00267                                         }                               
00268                                 }
00269                                 
00270                                 // STEP 2: CALCULATE THE APPROPRIATE VALUES
00271                                 switch(eg_state){
00272                                         case k_eg_attack:                                               // ATTACK
00273                                                 output += attack_step;                                  // Increment the output
00274                                                 if (output >= 1.0){                                             // If we've hit the top of the attack,
00275                                                         eg_state = k_eg_decay;                          // start the decay stage
00276                                                         output = 1.0;                                           // Make sure we didn't go over 1.0
00277                                                 }               
00278                                                 break;
00279                                         case k_eg_decay:                                                // DECAY
00280                                                 output -= decay_step;                                   // Decrement the output
00281                                                 if (output <= sustain_amp){                             // If we've hit the bottom of the decay,
00282                                                         eg_state = k_eg_sustain;                        // start the sustain stage
00283                                                         output = sustain_amp;                           // Lock in the sustain value
00284                                                 }
00285                                                 break;
00286                                         case k_eg_sustain:                                              // SUSTAIN
00287                                                 break;                                                                  // leave it alone
00288                                                                         
00289                                         case k_eg_release:                                              // RELEASE
00290                                                 output -= release_step;                                 // Decrement the output
00291                                                 if (output <= 0.0){                                             // If we've hit the basement,
00292                                                         eg_state = k_eg_inactive;                       // deactivate the eg
00293                                                         output = 0.0;                                           // Make sure we didn't dip too low
00294                                                 }
00295                                                 break;
00296                                 }
00297                                 
00298                                 // STEP 3: OUTPUT                                               
00299                         *out->vector++ = output;
00300                     }
00301                     in->reset(); out->reset();
00302                 }

00305                 // DSP LOOP: CONTROL-RATE TRIGGER - EXPONENTIAL
00306                 void dsp_vector_calc_exponential(tt_audio_signal *out)
00307                 {
00308                         temp_vs = out->vectorsize;
00309                     while(temp_vs--){
00310                     
00311                         // STEP 1: SET THE CORRECT STATE
00312                                 if(trigger){                    // WHEN THE TRIGGER IS ON
00313                                         if((eg_state == k_eg_inactive) || (eg_state == k_eg_release)){  // if a note isn't on,
00314                                                 eg_state = k_eg_attack;                                                                         // set to attack
00315                                         }
00316                                 }
00317                                 else{                                   // WHEN THE TRIGGER IS OFF
00318                                         if((eg_state != k_eg_inactive) && (eg_state != k_eg_release)){  // if a note is on,
00319                                                 eg_state = k_eg_release;                                                                        // release it
00320                                         }                               
00321                                 }
00322                                 
00323                                 // STEP 2: CALCULATE THE APPROPRIATE VALUES
00324                                 switch(eg_state){
00325                                         case k_eg_attack:                                               // ATTACK
00326                                                 output_db += attack_step_db;                    // Increment the output
00327                                                 output = decibels_to_amplitude(output_db);
00328                                                 if (output_db >= 0.0){                                          // If we've hit the top of the attack,
00329                                                         eg_state = k_eg_decay;                          // start the decay stage
00330                                                         output = 1.0;                                           // Make sure we didn't go over 1.0
00331                                                 }               
00332                                                 break;
00333                                         case k_eg_decay:                                                // DECAY
00334                                                 output_db -= decay_step_db;
00335                                                 output = decibels_to_amplitude(output_db);      // Decrement the output
00336                                                 if (output <= sustain_amp){                             // If we've hit the bottom of the decay,
00337                                                         eg_state = k_eg_sustain;                        // start the sustain stage
00338                                                         output = sustain_amp;                           // Lock in the sustain value
00339                                                 }
00340                                                 break;
00341                                         case k_eg_sustain:                                              // SUSTAIN
00342                                                 break;                                                                  // leave it alone
00343                                                                         
00344                                         case k_eg_release:                                              // RELEASE
00345                                                 output_db -= release_step_db;
00346                                                 output = decibels_to_amplitude(output_db);              // Decrement the output
00347                                                 if (output_db <= NOISE_FLOOR){                                          // If we've hit the basement,
00348                                                         eg_state = k_eg_inactive;                       // deactivate the eg
00349                                                         output = 0.0;                                           // Make sure we didn't dip too low
00350                                                 }
00351                                                 break;
00352                                 }
00353                                 
00354                                 // STEP 3: OUTPUT                                               
00355                         *out->vector++ = output;
00356                     }
00357                     out->reset();
00358                 }

00361                 // DSP LOOP: SIGNAL TRIGGER - EXPONENTIAL
00362                 void dsp_vector_calc_exponential(tt_audio_signal *in, tt_audio_signal *out)
00363                 {
00364                         temp_vs = out->vectorsize;
00365                     while(temp_vs--){
00366                         trigger = (bool)((*in->vector++) > 0.5);        // **** SIGNAL-RATE TRIGGER
00367                         
00368                         // STEP 1: SET THE CORRECT STATE
00369                                 if(trigger){                    // WHEN THE TRIGGER IS ON
00370                                         if((eg_state == k_eg_inactive) || (eg_state == k_eg_release)){  // if a note isn't on,
00371                                                 eg_state = k_eg_attack;                                                                         // set to attack
00372                                         }
00373                                 }
00374                                 else{                                   // WHEN THE TRIGGER IS OFF
00375                                         if((eg_state != k_eg_inactive) && (eg_state != k_eg_release)){  // if a note is on,
00376                                                 eg_state = k_eg_release;                                                                        // release it
00377                                         }                               
00378                                 }
00379                                 
00380                                 // STEP 2: CALCULATE THE APPROPRIATE VALUES
00381                                 switch(eg_state){
00382                                         case k_eg_attack:                                               // ATTACK
00383                                                 output_db += attack_step_db;                    // Increment the output
00384                                                 output = decibels_to_amplitude(output_db);
00385                                                 if (output_db >= 0.0){                                          // If we've hit the top of the attack,
00386                                                         eg_state = k_eg_decay;                          // start the decay stage
00387                                                         output = 1.0;                                           // Make sure we didn't go over 1.0
00388                                                 }               
00389                                                 break;
00390                                         case k_eg_decay:                                                // DECAY
00391                                                 output_db -= decay_step_db;
00392                                                 output = decibels_to_amplitude(output_db);      // Decrement the output
00393                                                 if (output <= sustain_amp){                             // If we've hit the bottom of the decay,
00394                                                         eg_state = k_eg_sustain;                        // start the sustain stage
00395                                                         output = sustain_amp;                           // Lock in the sustain value
00396                                                 }
00397                                                 break;
00398                                         case k_eg_sustain:                                              // SUSTAIN
00399                                                 break;                                                                  // leave it alone
00400                                                                         
00401                                         case k_eg_release:                                              // RELEASE
00402                                                 output_db -= release_step_db;
00403                                                 output = decibels_to_amplitude(output_db);              // Decrement the output
00404                                                 if (output_db <= NOISE_FLOOR){                                          // If we've hit the basement,
00405                                                         eg_state = k_eg_inactive;                       // deactivate the eg
00406                                                         output = 0.0;                                           // Make sure we didn't dip too low
00407                                                 }
00408                                                 break;
00409                                 }
00410                                 
00411                                 // STEP 3: OUTPUT                                               
00412                         *out->vector++ = output;
00413                     }
00414                     in->reset(); out->reset();
00415                 }
